title: The End of Transactional Religion
description:
The heart of much religion is a transaction with the spiritual in order to secure what we want. When we manage our individual relationships this way we offend those we say we love. Why wouldn't this offend a personal God? 

The joy of the end of the Babylonian Exile gave way to the muddle of conflict and unrealized expectations. A Remnant returned from Babylon only to face problems with those who remained in the land.
